articles.description: A court in Spain has sentenced Alves, who played for Barcelona and Brazil, to four and a half years.
articles.title: Dani Alves trial: Ex-Brazil player guilty of nightclub rape

articles.description: England name Ollie Robinson and Shoaib Bashir in their team for the fourth Test against India as Mark Wood and Rehan Ahmed drop out.
articles.title: Robinson & Bashir in England XI for fourth Test

articles.description: Reaction as Arsenal lose at Porto in Champions League and Liverpool beat Luton to extend lead at top of Premier League, plus Lionesses news conference.
articles.title: Champions League & Premier League reaction plus Lionesses news conferences

articles.description: England captain Ben Stokes says he has never seen anything like the cracked pitch for the fourth Test against India in Ranchi.
articles.title: Stokes has 'never seen' anything like Ranchi pitch

articles.description: Manager Jurgen Klopp feels Chelsea are "definitely" favourites for Sunday's EFL Cup final but says a depleted Liverpool "will go for it" after they beat Luton to extend their Premier League lead.
articles.title: 'As long as we have 11 players, we will go for it' - Klopp

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta insists his side will learn from defeat before the second leg of their Champions League last-16 tie in north London.
articles.title: 'Kick in the teeth', but Arteta insists Arsenal will learn

articles.description: Charlie Woods, the teenage son of golf legend Tiger, will start his attempt to qualify for a first PGA Tour event on Thursday.
articles.title: Tiger Woods' son Charlie, 15, aiming to qualify for PGA Tour event

articles.description: Two years on from Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Elina Svitolina represents her country on court and in the conflict.
articles.title: Elina Svitolina: The star and the kids who play on through horror

articles.description: Arsenal are stunned as Galeno scores in stoppage time to give Porto the advantage from the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie.
articles.title: Galeno scores late winner as Porto stun Arsenal

articles.description: Liverpool move four points clear at the top of the Premier League table after coming from behind to beat Luton at Anfield.
articles.title: Liverpool beat Luton to move four points clear at top
